post_info.post_title: Technology creates more problems than it solves

Technology gave you the time to have that thought.

Progress is inevitable - change or die.
 
 We are "programmed" to improve our lot in life. Technology is one way of doing that.
 
 Now, how one uses that technology could create many, many problems.
 
 Ever noticed that with all these time-saving devices that you never have time to do anything? :p

i think technology, as well as any other type of "civil progress" creates new problems to about the same extent as it solves. the thing is, this has nothing to do with the technology itself, which can neither be good or bad, but with the human condition of greed, discontent, laziness and curiousity. technology helps to accelerate the development of new technology, which in turn accelerates again, creating an exponential curve in development. this is also spurred by an exponential growth in human greed, discontent, laziness and curiousity.
 
 depending on what you value, this question can be answered either way. i personally prefer the "good ol' days" of less technology and more manual labour, less luxury and more elementary skill building and communialism. and of course i can easily imagine people that would prefer exactly the opposite. it depends on your perspective. i can elaborate on mine later
